meanings.definition: Dwales (noun): a state of confusion or dizziness
meanings.sent1: After spinning around too fast, I felt the dwales coming on.
meanings.sent2: The room's spinning caused me to experience dwales.
meanings.sent3: Trying to read upside down always leads to dwales for me.
meanings.sent4: The maze of mirrors created a sense of dwales in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The sudden drop on the roller coaster left me with intense dwales.

meanings.definition: Dwales (verb): to become faint or dizzy
meanings.sent1: The heat made me dwales while waiting in line.
meanings.sent2: She tends to dwales when standing up too quickly.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks seemed to dwales the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news caused him to dwales with shock.
meanings.sent5: The strong medication can sometimes make patients dwales.
